page.title: 09Farm Accomodation.
page.content: There are several types of farm accommodation in the area ranging from the large{"Halls",}homes of the estate owners, to the small{cottages}often occupied by farm-workers. There are two halls on our survey, one at Harehope and the other, where Oliver Cromwell once stayed, at Eglingham. Both are partially let in flats. There are also several{farm houses}affording normal family accomodation. Most farm-workers live in the cottages grouped on the estates; none own their own homes in our particular region. One of the cottages, once the home of a coffin-maker, has no electricity! There is no mains gas in the area although the pipe-line from the North Sea runs through Beanley! Automation has reduced the number of farm workers and so several cottages are now let to non-farm workers or as{"holiday homes"
